intro: Sonerila angustata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sonerila, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with four petals and prominent stamens. Sonerila angustata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky crevices.
